fields.name: 24 hour prediction stop
fields.text: Stop: The risk of runoff associated with more than 0.5 inches of rain after application is too high. Do not apply at this time.

fields.name: 24 hour prediction caution
fields.text: Caution: More than 0.25 inches of rain can cause a runoff event on saturated soils. Pay extreme caution and/or limit manure application.

fields.name: 72 hour prediction stop
fields.text: Stop: The risk of runoff associated with more than 0.5 inches of rain after application is too high. Do not apply at this time.

fields.name: 72 hour prediction caution
fields.text: Caution: More than 0.25 inches of rain can cause a runoff event on saturated soils. Pay extreme caution and/or limit manure application.

fields.name: soil moisture stop
fields.text: Stop: Do not apply at this time. The soil moisture is too high and the risk of runoff on this field is very high.

fields.name: soil moisture caution
fields.text: Caution: You may be at risk for runoff. Check field conditions and the forecast, and apply only at or below recommended rates.

fields.name: water table depth stop
fields.text: Stop: The water table is too close to the soil surface for safe application at this time. Wait until it recedes  before manure is applied.

fields.name: water table depth caution
fields.text: Caution: There is an elevated water table at this location. Watch for ponding in low spots, high soil moisture, and groundwater contamination.

fields.name: forage density caution 1
fields.text: Caution: 100 foot setbacks from ditches, waterways, etc, are required unless an adequate filter strip is in place.

fields.name: forage density caution 2
fields.text: Caution: Cover is adequate, but make sure a dense filter strip lies adjacent to any waterways.

fields.name: forage height stop
fields.text: Cover height is not adequate to properly function: Instate a 100 manure setback distance from critical areas

fields.name: forage height caution
fields.text: Caution: Make sure vegetation is dense and able to properly filter runoff

fields.name: ponding caution
fields.text: Caution: Avoid ponded areas with appropriate setback distance, particularly if they drain to waterways.

fields.name: frozen stop
fields.text: Stop: Application is not permitted  on ground that is frozen more than 1 inch down, or covered by more than 1 inch of snow. A dusting of snow or surface crust freezing is okay for application.

fields.name: tiles present
fields.text: Caution: Tiles must have at least 24 inches of cover, not be discharging manure, and their location must be known prior to application. Monitor tiles closely after application. If manure discharges from tile, plug immediately.

fields.name: surface application
fields.text: Caution: Recommend that you apply so that manure is below the grass canopy. Watch for compaction on your field. Follow current manure setback distances.

fields.name: irrigation sprinkler
fields.text: Caution: While this method decreases compaction issues, it may increase the likelihood of runoff of manure from the surface of your field. Be sure to observe manure setbacks from critical areas at all times.

fields.name: water body critical area
fields.text: Caution: Be sure the follow all vegetative buffer width and setback guidelines in your DNMP. Continue filling out worksheet.
